page.title: 18What matters in Thurlow
page.content: The contents of th Parish Council Minute Book reflect local concerns, all of which relate to the immediate environment and endeavours to keep it safe and pleasant. Planning applications are carefully considered and objections raised if local opinion warrants this. Pride in the appearance of the village extends to the planting of ornamental trees and entry into the Best Kept Village competition. Many villagers would like to see improved bus services. Although only a minority use cross ountry footpaths most agree they should be kept open.
